trans-unit.source: Accessing Azure Active Directory Graph Information (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Accessing Azure Active Directory Graph Information (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to access Azure Active Directory information using the Graph API in your Windows Store application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to access Azure Active Directory information using the Graph API in your Windows Store application.

trans-unit.source: Accessing Azure Active Directory Graph Information
trans-unit.target: Accessing Azure Active Directory Graph Information

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Like the other identity providers offered with Mobile Services, the Azure Active Directory (AAD) provider also supports a rich Graph API which can be used for programmatic access to the directory.
trans-unit.target: Like the other identity providers offered with Mobile Services, the Azure Active Directory (AAD) provider also supports a rich Graph API which can be used for programmatic access to the directory.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you update the ToDoList app to personalize the authenticated user’s app experience returning additional user information you retrieve from the directory using the [Graph REST API].
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you update the ToDoList app to personalize the authenticated user’s app experience returning additional user information you retrieve from the directory using the [Graph REST API].

trans-unit.source: For more information on the Azure AD Graph API, see the [Azure Active Directory Graph Team Blog].
trans-unit.target: For more information on the Azure AD Graph API, see the [Azure Active Directory Graph Team Blog].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The intent of this tutorial is to extend your knowledge of authentication with the Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The intent of this tutorial is to extend your knowledge of authentication with the Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: It is expected that you have completed the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial using the Azure Active Directory authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: It is expected that you have completed the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial using the Azure Active Directory authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial continues to update the TodoItem application used in the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial continues to update the TodoItem application used in the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must have already completed these Mobile Services tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must have already completed these Mobile Services tutorials:

trans-unit.source: Adds a login requirement to the TodoList sample app.
trans-unit.target: Adds a login requirement to the TodoList sample app.

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to call a custom API.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to call a custom API.

trans-unit.source: Generate an access key for the App registration in AAD
trans-unit.target: Generate an access key for the App registration in AAD

trans-unit.source: During the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial, you created a registration for the integrated application when you completed the [Register to use an Azure Active Directory Login] step.
trans-unit.target: During the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial, you created a registration for the integrated application when you completed the [Register to use an Azure Active Directory Login] step.

trans-unit.source: In this section you generate a key to be used when reading directory information with that integrated application's client ID.
trans-unit.target: In this section you generate a key to be used when reading directory information with that integrated application's client ID.

trans-unit.source: Create a GetUserInfo custom API
trans-unit.target: Create a GetUserInfo custom API

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will create the GetUserInfo custom API that will use the [Graph REST API] to retrieve additional information about the user from the AAD.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will create the GetUserInfo custom API that will use the [Graph REST API] to retrieve additional information about the user from the AAD.

trans-unit.source: If you've never used custom APIs with Mobile Services, you should consider reviewing the [Custom API Tutorial] before completing this section.
trans-unit.target: If you've never used custom APIs with Mobile Services, you should consider reviewing the [Custom API Tutorial] before completing this section.

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal], create the new GetUserInfo custom API for your mobile service and set permissions for the get method to **Only Authenticated Users**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal], create the new GetUserInfo custom API for your mobile service and set permissions for the get method to **Only Authenticated Users**.

trans-unit.source: Open the script editor for the new GetUserInfo API and that the following variables to the top of the script.
trans-unit.target: Open the script editor for the new GetUserInfo API and that the following variables to the top of the script.

trans-unit.source: Add the following definition for the `getAADToken` function.
trans-unit.target: Add the following definition for the `getAADToken` function.

trans-unit.source: Given the *tenant_domain*, integrated application *client id*, and application *key*, this function provides a Graph access token used for reading directory information.
trans-unit.target: Given the *tenant_domain*, integrated application *client id*, and application *key*, this function provides a Graph access token used for reading directory information.

trans-unit.source: Add the following `getUser` function which uses the Graph API to return the user's information.
trans-unit.target: Add the following `getUser` function which uses the Graph API to return the user's information.

trans-unit.source: This function is a thin wrapper around the [Get User] endpoint of the Graph REST API.
trans-unit.target: This function is a thin wrapper around the [Get User] endpoint of the Graph REST API.

trans-unit.source: It uses the Graph access token to get the user information using the user's object ID.
trans-unit.target: It uses the Graph access token to get the user information using the user's object ID.

trans-unit.source: Update the exported `get` method as follows to return user information using the other functions.
trans-unit.target: Update the exported `get` method as follows to return user information using the other functions.

trans-unit.source: Update the app to use GetUserInfo
trans-unit.target: Update the app to use GetUserInfo

trans-unit.source: In this section you will update the `AuthenticateAsync` method you implemented in the [Get Started with Authentication] tutorial to call the custom API and return additional information about the user from the AAD.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will update the `AuthenticateAsync` method you implemented in the [Get Started with Authentication] tutorial to call the custom API and return additional information about the user from the AAD.

trans-unit.source: Test the app
trans-unit.target: Test the app

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, [Role based access control with the AAD in Mobile Services], you will use role based access control with the Azure Active Directory (AAD) to check group membership before allowing access.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, [Role based access control with the AAD in Mobile Services], you will use role based access control with the Azure Active Directory (AAD) to check group membership before allowing access.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
